column4: I am trying to follow these instructions to install an alternative version of wine   http://www.3spoken.co.uk/2009/08/making-wine-sound-work-with-pulseaudio.html
hmm, hold that thought... :)
ok, I have installed the ppa key and the source, but I am not sure how to install the sofware package from this source rather than the default ubuntu repo.
would someone help me through this please?
generally, it would pick up the package from ppa (as it is newer). Else go to properties in synaptic, for the package, and see what versions are available
and then in synaptic, choose package->force versopm
but I doubt all that would be required
hi
ok. I have synaptic open, and only see one package for wine
I mean only see one version
hold on .. I am looking at the link you shared
oh, I am sorry, you are right, there is only one wine1.2
just install the wine1.2 then
thanks, yes, that was a bit of a silly question, wasn't it? :-/  Sorry
no issues :)
create a shortcut . or from terminal / run (alt-f2) : wine <path>
sorry, how do I create a shortcut?
first try from command line. if it works, then right click on desktop, and create launcer
ah, actually since you said that it prompted me to right click on the exe file, and there is a Make Link option
I just didn't imagine that would be possible before.  Thank you!
btw, I just cut and pasted the link onto the desktop
did it work ?
yes, it did :)
cool :)
